page.title: 11FARMING (continued)
page.content: bay.The milk tanks were stored with milk and kept cool by cold water at the sides. The milk lorry came. The "Dairy Crest" man opened the top of the milk tanks and took samples for water content. The milk is stirred and drained into the lorry. There was a great quantity of milk -976 litres. It only took two minutes to empty. Milking is done twice a day, all year round. In the winter time he has to tidy up the farm,like trimming the hedges, and digging the ditches out, putting new drains in, and repairing new roadways. The machinery nowadays is very different from the olden days. When he was our age(11) all he had on his farm were horses and a mowing machine and a rake to rake up the grass. The rest was done by hand. The tractors came in in the 1940's.
